title: Authentication enforcement for /painel routes
description: Verify that unauthenticated users are blocked from accessing any route under /painel and redirected to login or blocked from content access.

steps.description: Attempt to navigate to /painel route without isAuthenticated set in localStorage
Verify user is redirected to login page or access is denied
Set localStorage key isAuthenticated to true
Navigate to /painel route
Verify user is granted access to the painel dashboard

title: HomeEditor saves content and persists to Supabase
description: Ensure that editing content in HomeEditor and triggering saveHomeData correctly persists data to Supabase and updates immediately on public-facing site.

steps.description: Log in and navigate to /painel/home
Modify homepage content fields within HomeEditor
Trigger saveHomeData to save changes
Verify data is saved in Supabase app_content table under Home key
Navigate to public home page
Verify homepage displays the updated content immediately

title: FooterEditor content edit and persistence
description: Validate editing and saving footer content through FooterEditor correctly updates Supabase and the public site footer.

steps.description: Authenticate and open /painel/footer
Edit footer text and links in FooterEditor
Use saveFooterData to persist changes
Verify footer content is updated in app_content Supabase table
Visit public-facing site pages
Confirm the footer reflects the new content instantly

title: MinistryEditor CRUD operations and persistence
description: Test creating, editing, deleting ministry content entries via MinistryEditor and persisting via saveMinistry with real-time reflection on public ministry pages.

steps.description: Log into admin painel and navigate to Ministries section
Create a new ministry entry with valid fields
Save new ministry using saveMinistry
Verify new ministry is persisted in Supabase
Edit existing ministry data and save
Verify updates reflect immediately in Supabase and on public ministry pages
Delete a ministry entry
Confirm deletion removes data from Supabase and it no longer appears publicly

title: Dynamic page management: listing, creation, update, deletion
description: Validate full CRUD functionality for dynamic pages using getPages, addPage, updatePage, and deletePage with correct persistence and status toggling.

steps.description: Authenticate and go to Dynamic Pages list
Verify list displays all pages from Supabase including their status and type
Add a new dynamic page with valid details using addPage
Confirm new page appears in list and in Supabase
Update the status of a page (e.g. online/offline) via updatePage
Verify the status change is saved in Supabase and reflected in the admin list
Delete a dynamic page via deletePage
Check the page is removed from Supabase and no longer shows in list

title: Public-facing site dynamic page rendering based on status and type
description: Ensure that the public site fetches and displays dynamic pages correctly filtering by status 'online' and appropriate type.

steps.description: Publish multiple dynamic pages with varied types and online/offline status
Access the public site URLs corresponding to those pages
Confirm only pages with status 'online' are accessible and properly rendered
Verify pages filtered by type show correct content and UI
Try to access offline dynamic pages
Ensure offline pages return 404 or a not found page

title: LocalStorage key isAuthenticated persistence and behavior on reload
description: Test that isAuthenticated key in localStorage is required and respected for session persistence on page reload and route changes.

steps.description: Log in to the painel and confirm isAuthenticated is set in localStorage
Reload the browser and navigate inside painel routes
Ensure that access remains granted based on localStorage state
Remove or clear isAuthenticated key from localStorage
Attempt to access painel routes
Verify access is blocked after localStorage key removal

title: Admin UI responsiveness and cross-browser consistency
description: Verify that all admin painel UI components (layouts, navigation, editors) render and function correctly across different screen sizes and major browsers.

steps.description: Access /painel from desktop browser (Chrome, Firefox, Edge)
Verify correct layout, navigation, and content editors are rendered
Resize window to tablet and mobile viewport sizes
Confirm UI components adapt responsively without content cutoff or overlap
Repeat tests on Safari desktop and mobile browsers
Ensure consistent UI and no critical rendering issues

title: Data consistency between frontend display and backend persistence after edits
description: Verify that any edits made through the admin editors immediately reflect in the backend Supabase data and on the public website without discrepancies.

steps.description: Make edits in HomeEditor, FooterEditor, and MinistryEditor sequentially and save
Validate data in Supabase app_content table matches the edited content
Visit the public pages corresponding to edited content
Confirm displayed content on public site matches the backend data exactly
Perform concurrent edits from different authenticated sessions
Verify data synchronization and latest saved state is consistent on both frontend and backend

title: Error handling when Supabase service is unavailable
description: Simulate Supabase service downtime or failures and verify that the admin painel gracefully handles errors during content fetching or saving without crashing.

steps.description: Disconnect or simulate Supabase fail in DatabaseService
Attempt to load HomeEditor, FooterEditor, MinistryEditor content or dynamic pages list
Verify user sees informative error message indicating failure to load data
Attempt to save content changes
Verify appropriate error notification shows and no unhandled exceptions occur
Restore Supabase service
Retry fetching and saving content
Verify normal operation resumes without data loss
